answers.answer: I had gestational diabetes with both of my kids, and yes you might have to have a c section!  I did not have one with my first child, and I was in labor for 48 hours!!!  My second they did not give me a choice, I had to have a c section.  Just remember it put a lot less stress on the baby to have a c section.  Do what is best for the baby, and that maybe a c setion.  How far along are you?  Are you older, or over weight?  Do they think it's gestational, or regular diabetes?  Do you have a history in your family of diabetes?  Make sure you watch this very closely.  Usually the main side effect of gestaional diabetes is a very large baby,  that's the main reason for the c section.  Keep me posted I'll help if I can!Justina

question: From the blood levels last time in the ER,they say it looks like I have diabetes.They are testing me on Tuesday to confirm this or not..This would explain the dizziness and being bloatded all the time.I know litle about diabetes and I am worried.I was wanting to try to have a natural birth after having the last two c-section.I read some where that is you have diabetes you will more then likly have to have your baby by c-section.Does anyone know if thats true or not?Or does anyone else have diabetes because of pregnancy?Also my unexplained bleeding would be possibly caused by having diabetes?
title: the dr thinks I have diabetes
